intro: Mikania sanderi, commonly known as the silverleaf mikania, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Mikania sanderi is a perennial vine that thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
